result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon J. Lige Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:35 AM Defendant Vernon J. Lige Jr. in court.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court for Vernon J. Lige Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads guilty to count one. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Court orders sentence withheld, three years probation with conditions, Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary, parenting course, no contact with R.J.P. and  R.L.P. unless approved by DOC,  Defendant to get his driver license Court costs due January 6, 2023. Count two is dismissed and read in.  3 days credit.

03:05 PM Defendant Vernon J. Lige in court by video in custody with attorney Faun Michelle Moses by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $2000 set with conditions of no contact with R.L.P or R.J.P. No intentional contact with with any minors besides those the Defendant takes care of. No coroporal punishment at all.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
